This repository contains data and R source code accompanying our
manuscript,

> Zhengrong Xing and Matthew Stephens (2016). *Smoothing via Adaptive
Shrinkage (smash): denoising Poisson and heteroskedastic Gaussian
signals.* [arXiv:1709.10066][smash-preprint].

If you find any of the source code in this repository useful for your
work, please cite our paper.

The new methods can be found in the [smashr package][smashr].

## Contents

The following analyses generate some of the empirical results
presented in [Xing & Stephens (2016)][smash-preprint]. If you
encounter a problem running any of the R code in these examples,
please post an [issue][issues].

+ [**Illustration:** SMASH applied to the "spikes"
data set.](spikesdemo.html)

+ **Comparisons of signal denoising methods in simulated data:**

   - [Estimating the mean signal from Gaussian-distributed
      data.](gausshomo.html)
   - Estimating the variance function from Gaussian-distributed data.
   - Poisson-distributed data.

+ **Illustrative applications:**

   - [Motorcycle acceleration data.](motorcycle.html)
   - [ChIP-seq data.](chipseq.html)
